definitions: made of or containing the precious metal gold
having a bright yellow color like that of gold metal
marked by great success, prosperity, or outstanding achievement in life
examples: She wore a beautiful golden necklace to the party
The museum displayed ancient golden artifacts from Egypt
The golden sunset painted the sky with warm colors
Her golden hair shimmered in the morning sunlight
They're living in their golden years after retirement
It was the golden age of cinema and television

definitions: cruel, spiteful, or unfair in behavior toward others
calculated as the average value in a set of numbers
excellent, skillful, or impressive in quality or ability
examples: That was a mean thing to say to your sister
The mean kids at school always picked on newcomers
The mean temperature this month was seventy degrees Fahrenheit
Calculate the mean score from all test results
She plays a mean guitar in the band
He cooks a mean chili that wins contests

definitions: showing the characteristics expected of or popularly associated with something
serving as a characteristic or representative example of something
examples: It was a typical Monday morning with heavy traffic everywhere
This painting shows typical features of the Renaissance period
This building is typical of modern architectural design trends
Her response was typical of someone in that situation

definitions: having life, not dead or inanimate
used as a place or way to maintain one's life
examples: All living creatures need water to survive on Earth
She's the greatest living artist of our generation
The living room is where the family gathers daily
He makes his living as a freelance photographer

definitions: firm and stable in shape, not liquid or gas
dependable, reliable, and worthy of trust in character or quality
having no gaps, breaks, or holes throughout its structure
examples: The frozen lake was solid enough to walk on
This table is made of solid oak wood
She has solid experience in marketing and sales management
Their friendship has remained solid through difficult times
The wall was built with solid concrete blocks throughout
He worked for eight solid hours without taking breaks

definitions: mentally ill or unable to behave in a reasonable way
very angry or annoyed about something or with someone
very enthusiastic or excited about something
examples: The mad scientist worked alone in his laboratory
People thought he was mad for attempting such danger
She was mad at him for forgetting their anniversary
Don't get mad, but I accidentally broke your vase
He's mad about vintage cars and collects them
The crowd went mad when their team scored

definitions: moving or capable of moving at high speed
firmly fixed, attached, or closed so as not to move
abstaining from all or some kinds of food or drink
examples: The fast train reaches the city in two hours
She's a fast runner who wins most races
Make sure the rope is fast before you climb
The door was stuck fast and wouldn't open
Muslims fast during the holy month of Ramadan daily
The doctor recommended a fast before the medical procedure

definitions: present at this time or in this place
having being or existence in reality or actuality
examples: We need to work within existing budget constraints this year
The existing software needs major updates to function properly
All existing members must renew their subscriptions by December
The company will maintain existing contracts through next year

definitions: of very great extent or size in area or dimensions
very great in quantity, amount, intensity, or degree
examples: The vast ocean stretched endlessly before the small boat
They own vast tracts of land in the countryside
She has vast knowledge of ancient history and languages
The project required vast amounts of time and resources

definitions: relating to or characteristic of Germany, its people, or culture
relating to the German language spoken in central Europe
examples: We enjoyed traditional German food at the Oktoberfest celebration
The German economy is the largest in Europe
She's taking German classes to communicate with her relatives
This document needs translation from German to English

definitions: involving or requiring specialized knowledge or training in a particular area
relating to the practical use of machines or science in industry
examples: The manual contains technical information about computer programming
She has technical expertise in aerospace engineering
They encountered technical difficulties during the live broadcast
The athlete's technical skills impressed all the judges

definitions: acting or done in the same way over time
compatible or in agreement with something
examples: She maintains consistent quality in all her work projects
The team needs consistent practice to improve their performance
Your story isn't consistent with the evidence we found
These results are consistent with our initial hypothesis

definitions: closely connected or appropriate to what is being done or considered
having significant bearing on the matter at hand
examples: Please provide only relevant information for the job application
Her experience is highly relevant to this position
The judge excluded evidence that wasn't relevant to the case
Make sure your comments are relevant to the discussion

definitions: having too much flesh or adipose tissue on the body
containing a large amount of fat or oil
thick, substantial, or large in size or amount
examples: The fat cat couldn't fit through the pet door
He's trying to lose fat through diet and exercise
Avoid fat foods if you want to stay healthy
The meat was too fat for her dietary preferences
She received a fat paycheck after working overtime hours
The publisher offered a fat advance for her novel

definitions: situated above another part or at a higher level
higher in rank, status, or authority than others
examples: The upper floors offer better views of the city
Pain in her upper back required medical attention
He belongs to the upper management of the company
The upper classes lived in a different neighborhood

definitions: relating to seeing or sight
able to be seen or perceived by the eye
examples: The teacher used visual aids to explain complex concepts
She has excellent visual memory for faces and places
The visual effects in the movie were absolutely stunning
Artists create visual representations of abstract ideas

definitions: relating to Japan, its people, culture, or customs
relating to the Japanese language spoken in Japan
examples: We enjoyed authentic Japanese cuisine at the new restaurant
Japanese technology companies lead in electronics innovation
She's studying Japanese to work in Tokyo next year
Can you translate this Japanese text into English?

definitions: of a color between black and white like ash or lead
dull, depressing, or lacking in brightness or interest
not clearly defined or morally ambiguous
examples: The gray clouds promised rain later in the afternoon
She wore a stylish gray suit to the interview
It was another gray day in the industrial city
His gray mood affected everyone around him
The law exists in a gray area between legal and illegal
There are many gray areas in this ethical dilemma

definitions: expected to happen, arrive, or be done at a particular time
owed as a debt or an obligation
appropriate, proper, or required in the circumstances
examples: The baby is due in early March next year
Your library books are due back by Friday
The rent is due on the first of each month
Payment is due within thirty days of invoice
Give credit where due for their hard work
After due consideration, we accepted the proposal

definitions: based on good sense or logic rather than emotion
not too expensive or extreme in price or amount
fairly good but not outstanding in quality or ability
examples: Her request for extra time seemed perfectly reasonable
It's reasonable to expect punctuality from professional employees
The restaurant offers reasonable prices for quality food
They charge reasonable fees for their legal services
She has reasonable skills in computer programming
The team achieved reasonable success this season

definitions: carrying a developing offspring within the body
full of meaning or significance that is not expressed
examples: She's seven months pregnant with her first child
The pregnant cat needed extra care and nutrition
There was a pregnant pause before he answered
Her words were pregnant with hidden meaning

definitions: lacking the skill, means, or opportunity to do something
not allowed or not able due to circumstances
examples: He was unable to attend due to illness
The system is unable to process your request
We are unable to disclose that information publicly
She felt unable to cope with the pressure

definitions: using or involving physical force intended to hurt or damage
very strong, intense, or severe in force or effect
examples: The violent storm destroyed several homes in the area
Police arrested him for violent behavior at the protest
She felt violent nausea after eating the spoiled food
The movie depicts violent scenes of historical battles

definitions: relating to or determined by the sun
using the sun's energy as a source of power
examples: The solar system consists of eight planets orbiting the sun
Scientists study solar flares and their effects on Earth
They installed solar panels on their roof last summer
Solar energy is becoming more affordable for homeowners

definitions: having the ability, fitness, or quality necessary to do something
competent and able to achieve things efficiently
examples: She's capable of solving complex mathematical problems quickly
The new engine is capable of reaching high speeds
We need capable leaders to guide the organization forward
He's a capable manager who gets results

definitions: feeling or showing fear or nervousness
made afraid or anxious by something
examples: The scared child hid behind her mother's legs
I'm too scared to watch horror movies alone
She's scared of spiders and runs away from them
He was scared by the loud thunder last night

definitions: situated on or near the exterior or external surface
not belonging to or coming from within a group
examples: The outside temperature dropped below freezing last night
Please wait outside until we call your name
We need an outside consultant for objective advice
He felt like an outside observer at the meeting

definitions: relating to the human spirit or soul rather than material things
relating to religion or religious belief and practice
examples: She finds spiritual fulfillment through meditation and yoga
The book explores spiritual growth and personal development
The spiritual leader guided the community in prayer
They visited spiritual sites during their pilgrimage

definitions: twice as much or as many in size, amount, or number
consisting of two equal, identical, or similar parts or things
examples: The recipe calls for double the amount of sugar
Sales have double since we launched the new product
She ordered a double espresso to stay awake
The house has double doors at the entrance

definitions: involving or affecting large numbers of people or things
relating to the quantity of matter in a body
examples: Mass production lowered the cost of consumer goods significantly
The concert attracted a mass audience from across the country
Scientists calculate the mass of distant planets using telescopes
The mass of the object determines its gravitational pull

definitions: relating to the modern state of Israel or its people
of or relating to the citizens or culture of Israel
examples: The Israeli technology sector attracts global investment regularly
We studied Israeli history in our Middle Eastern course
Many Israeli citizens speak both Hebrew and English fluently
The museum features Israeli art from various periods

definitions: relating to or characterized by industry and manufacturing
having highly developed industries and factory production
examples: The industrial revolution changed society in fundamental ways
Safety regulations protect industrial workers from workplace hazards
This industrial area produces most of the nation's steel
The city transformed from agricultural to industrial economy

definitions: great in number or consisting of many members or individuals
too many to be counted or very many in quantity
examples: She received numerous awards for her scientific research
There are numerous ways to solve this mathematical problem
Numerous guests attended the wedding celebration last weekend
The report contains numerous errors that need correction

definitions: not mixed or adulterated with any other substance or material
free from immorality or evil, especially sexual immorality
nothing but, sheer, complete, or absolute in degree
examples: The jeweler certified the ring was pure gold
They use pure water in the laboratory experiments
She maintained pure thoughts despite the temptations around her
The choir's pure voices filled the cathedral beautifully
It was pure luck that we found the place
His motives were pure selfishness and personal gain

definitions: reaching a high or the highest degree, very great or intense
furthest from the center or a given point
examples: The extreme heat made outdoor work nearly impossible today
She takes extreme measures to protect her privacy
They live in the extreme north of the country
His political views are at the extreme end

definitions: serving as a deputy or substitute for someone
next in rank or authority to a principal position
examples: The vice president took charge during the president's absence
She serves as vice chair of the committee
He was promoted to vice admiral last year
The vice principal handles student discipline issues

definitions: sharing a particular activity, quality, or condition with someone
belonging to the same class or group
examples: My fellow students helped me prepare for the exam
She greeted her fellow travelers at the airport
He's a fellow member of the photography club
The fellow employees organized a surprise retirement party

definitions: having an edge or point that can cut or pierce
sudden and marked in effect or manner
quick to understand, notice, or respond with intelligence
examples: Be careful with that sharp knife in the kitchen
The sharp thorns on the rose bush drew blood
There was a sharp increase in prices last month
She felt a sharp pain in her lower back
He has a sharp mind for business opportunities
Her sharp wit made everyone laugh at dinner

definitions: following the religion of Islam
relating to the Muslims or their religion
examples: The Muslim community celebrates Eid with prayers and feasting
She follows Muslim dietary laws in her cooking
Muslim architecture features beautiful geometric patterns and calligraphy
We studied Muslim contributions to mathematics and science

definitions: making no sound or noise
not speaking or not expressing opinions
examples: The library was completely silent during study hours
Silent films relied on visual storytelling and music
She remained silent throughout the entire meeting yesterday
His silent protest spoke louder than words

definitions: extending or moving uniformly in one direction without curves
honest, direct, and straightforward in manner or speech
in continuous succession without interruption
examples: Draw a straight line between these two points
Her hair is naturally straight without any curls
I need a straight answer about what happened
He's always been straight with me about everything
She worked for ten straight hours without a break
The team won five straight games this season

definitions: easily agitated or alarmed, tending to be anxious or apprehensive
relating to the nerves or nervous system
examples: She felt nervous before her job interview this morning
The nervous dog barked at every strange sound
The doctor specializes in nervous system disorders and treatments
Nervous tissue transmits signals throughout the body

definitions: occurring or done at once without delay
nearest in time, space, order, or relationship
examples: We need an immediate response to this emergency situation
The medicine provided immediate relief from the pain
Only immediate family members can visit the patient
The immediate area around the building was evacuated

definitions: not habitually or commonly occurring or done
remarkable or interesting because different from what is normal
examples: It's unusual to see snow in April here
The doctor noted unusual symptoms in the patient
She has an unusual talent for learning languages quickly
The unusual design of the building attracts many tourists

definitions: not moving or making a sound
up to and including the present or the time mentioned
deep silence and calm, without movement
examples: The water in the pond was completely still
Please stand still while I take your photograph
She still lives in the same house after twenty years
Are you still working on that project?
In the still of the night, every sound seemed amplified
The still air made the heat feel more oppressive

definitions: of unknown name or whose name is withheld
lacking distinctive character or recognition
examples: The anonymous donor gave millions to the hospital
She received an anonymous letter with no return address
He preferred to remain anonymous in the crowd
The building's anonymous facade blended with its surroundings

definitions: belonging to or occurring in the present time
living or occurring at the same time
examples: The museum features contemporary art from local artists
Contemporary technology has transformed how we communicate daily
Shakespeare and Marlowe were contemporary writers in Elizabethan England
She studies contemporary authors who influenced each other

definitions: relating to or characteristic of the countryside rather than towns
characteristic of farming or country life
examples: Rural communities often lack access to high-speed internet
They moved from the city to a rural area
The rural landscape was dotted with farms and barns
Rural traditions are still practiced in many villages

definitions: very bad, serious, or undesirable in degree or intensity
strict or harsh in manner, attitude, or appearance
examples: The severe storm caused widespread damage across the region
She suffers from severe allergies during spring season
The teacher's severe expression silenced the noisy classroom
The judge imposed severe penalties for the crime

definitions: lasting or taking a short time
using few words or expressed concisely
examples: We had a brief meeting to discuss the proposal
There was a brief pause before she answered
Please give a brief summary of the main points
His brief response left many questions unanswered
